channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Coronavirus: Motor, transport firms face bigger blow from extended circuit breaker period
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:33 PM

SINGAPORE - The one-month extension to circuit breaker measures could have a devastating impact on the motor trade and transport sector, both of which are already reeling from a downward spiral in demand.

item.title: Doctors accused of having sex with patients have agreed not to contact female patients outside of work: SMC
item.description:
April 22, 2020 4:21 PM

A woman had complained to the SMC, the medical watchdog, that the doctors had taken advantage of vulnerable female patients and colleagues.

item.title: 4 charged with offences linked to masking up incidents, 2 others accused of offences including harassment
item.description:
April 22, 2020 4:18 PM

A man, who was allegedly caught on video verbally abusing a store supervisor with vulgarities and racist remarks, is accused of failing to wear a mask.

item.title: Coronavirus: ComfortDelGro extends rental waiver to cabbies by another month
item.description:
April 22, 2020 3:47 PM

SINGAPORE - Taxi giant ComfortDelGro will extend its full rental waiver to its cabbies by another month following news that safe-distancing measures will be tightened and extended till June 1.

item.title: 1,016 new coronavirus cases take Singapore tally past 10,000 mark
item.description:
April 22, 2020 3:14 PM

Among the new cases, 15 are Singaporeans and permanent residents, while foreign workers living in dormitories continue to drive the increase.

item.title: Supreme Court warns of scammers posing as its officers via phone calls, phishing e-mails
item.description:
April 22, 2020 2:43 PM

Fraudsters trick people over the phone into giving their personal details by telling them their attendance is required at court hearings.

item.title: Coronavirus: 6 youths in video fined for gathering on bridge and flouting safe distancing measures
item.description:
April 22, 2020 2:26 PM

The youths had taken a video showing one of them on the bridge commenting on the circuit breaker measures and making offensive gestures.

item.title: NGOs say healthy, natural environment should be a basic human right in light of coronavirus outbreak
item.description:
April 22, 2020 1:07 PM

SINGAPORE - The world's attention may have been attuned to the wildlife trade amid the global outbreak of Covid-19, the start of which has been traced to a market selling live animals in China.

item.title: Creator of Covid-19 superheroes in public campaign quits artist group he founded amid plagiarism rumours
item.description:
April 22, 2020 12:58 PM

The Gov.sg campaign was halted on Monday (April 20), just a day after its launch, seemingly in response to widespread public criticism.

item.title: Relief package by NTU to help students facing financial difficulties amid coronavirus outbreak
item.description:
April 22, 2020 11:32 AM

SINGAPORE - The Nanyang Technological University (NTU) has launched a private philanthropic programme to help its students, with the university's president Subra Suresh and his wife, Mrs Mary Suresh, making a personal gift of $100,000 to seed and anchor the fund.

item.title: Coronavirus: New restrictions for wet markets kick in but no shoppers turned away
item.description:
April 22, 2020 10:28 AM

Apart from NRICs, shoppers were also allowed to present their TransitLink concession cards, work permits, PAssion cards or driver's licences.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on April 22
item.description:
April 22, 2020 8:03 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Wednesday, April 22.

item.title: Coronavirus: Entry to 4 markets depends on last digit of your IC number
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

From today, those heading to four popular wet markets will be allowed to enter only on selected dates - depending on the last digit of their NRIC number.

item.title: Concerns over 'hidden reservoir' of coronavirus cases: PM Lee Hsien Loong
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

While the number of Covid-19 cases in the community has fallen in recent days, the number of unlinked cases has not come down, suggesting that there is a "larger, hidden reservoir" of cases, said Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong yesterday.

item.title: Petrol could fall below $2 a litre by next month
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Fuel pump prices are likely to fall in the coming days, although motorists are unlikely to see their bills shrinking by as much as the plunge in crude prices.

item.title: F&B outlets that sell mainly drinks, snacks and desserts to shut
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

All standalone food and beverage (F&B) outlets selling mainly drinks, snacks and desserts as well as hairdressing and barber shops will not be allowed to open from today until May 4.

item.title: Covid-19 superhero campaign taken down
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore's Covid-19-themed superhero team has beaten a hasty retreat before a swelling of negative public opinion, as the Gov.sg platform removed the Virus Vanguard campaign from its website and Facebook page just a day after launching it on Sunday.

item.title: LTA modifies MRT frequency to address crowding
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Trains should be less crowded from this week, after the Land Transport Authority (LTA) "fine-tuned" service frequency on Monday following an outcry from commuters last week.

item.title: Up to 3,000 coronavirus tests done daily, in 'very strategic' way
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore has been aggressively testing foreign workers for the coronavirus, even those who are well and have no symptoms, the multi-ministry task force told a press conference yesterday.

item.title: Not moving workers out of dorms earlier not just about cost: Minister
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Cost was not why foreign workers were not moved out of their dormitories earlier as part of efforts to curb the spread of the coronavirus, said Manpower Minister Josephine Teo yesterday.

item.title: NetLink Trust gets nod to resume installation work but manpower an issue
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Fibre network operator NetLink Trust (NLT) was yesterday given the go-ahead to resume installation work that requires visits to homes and offices, after services were suspended last week as four workers from one of its contractors tested positive for Covid-19.

item.title: Legitimate content that is free to watch online
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

While there are many dubious "free" streaming sites, a number of legitimate content owners have made some programmes free to watch online during this period when many places are in lockdown due to the coronavirus pandemic. Tune in.

item.title: Coronavirus: 10,000 workers in essential services moved out of dorms
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

About 10,000 foreign workers in essential services have been pulled out of dormitories while others staying in them have been barred from leaving the premises from yesterday until May 4.

item.title: Additional $3.8 billion to support businesses and workers
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore will extend wage support for businesses next month, as it prolongs the duration of the circuit breaker measures for another month to curb the spread of the coronavirus.

item.title: Illegal streaming websites may host malware
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

If it sounds too good to be true, it probably is. And that adage holds true for websites claiming to offer free access to thousands of the latest movies and television series.

item.title: Coronavirus: I tried to be cool but the happy tears just came, says recovered Certis officer
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Two months after being discharged from the isolation ward at Khoo Teck Puat Hospital (KTPH), the Certis officer who contracted Covid-19 is back at work, albeit no longer on the front lines.

item.title: Coronavirus: PM Lee Hsien Loong outlines steps needed for gradual exit from circuit breaker
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Lifting of measures to contain the Covid-19 outbreak will have to happen cautiously and incrementally, in conjunction with increased testing and better use of technology for contact tracing.

item.title: Coronavirus: June school holidays brought forward to May 5
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

The June school holidays will be brought forward to begin on May 5, to coincide with the one-month extension of the national circuit breaker period announced yesterday.

item.title: The Big Story: Is the Covid-19 circuit breaker extension necessary?
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Senior health correspondent Salma Khalik talks to infectious diseases experts about the extension of the circuit breaker period to June 1.Â

item.title: Coronavirus: Bubble tea, cake shops closed from today; no walk-in customers at optician shops
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Bubble tea outlets, cake shops and bak kwa shops are among those that will have to shut from today till May 4 at least.

item.title: Coronavirus: Rush for bubble tea as non-key businesses asked to shut
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Long queues were spotted at bubble tea shops across the island as Singaporeans tried to get their last fix of the sugary beverage before the stores temporarily shut their doors at 11.59pm yesterday.

item.title: Giving.sg sees record $13.6m in donations from April 1 to 19
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Donations on fund-raising website Giving.sg reached a record $13.6 million between April 1 and Sunday, as thousands of people responded to an online campaign encouraging Singaporeans to donate a part or all of their Solidarity Payment.

item.title: Coronavirus: Keep grocery shopping, exercise a solo affair, says Lawrence Wong
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

If you are leaving the house to pick up essential items or to exercise, do it alone and don't turn it into a family affair, National Development Minister Lawrence Wong said yesterday.

item.title: Parkway suspends doctor who lost defamation suit
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Dr Julian Ong, the surgeon who lost his defamation suit against a woman who had accused him of taking advantage of vulnerable patients, will not be allowed to practise at any of the Parkway hospitals from this week.

item.title: Majority of new coronavirus cases are foreign workers living in dorms
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Foreign workers living in dormitories continue to make up the majority of new coronavirus patients here, accounting for over 94 per cent of the 1,111 new cases announced yesterday.

item.title: Over 62,000 employers start getting foreign worker levy rebates
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Over 62,000 employers started getting their share of nearly $675 million in foreign worker levy rebates from yesterday, said the Ministry of Manpower (MOM).

item.title: Lifting circuit breaker would raise risk of coronavirus spread from dorms
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore faces two separate epidemics at the moment, a massive outbreak in the foreign worker dormitories and a more controlled community spread, with the possibility of one spilling over to the other, said Associate Professor Alex Cook.

item.title: S'pore Mufti urges Muslims to reflect on Ramadan's core
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

As Muslims in Singapore prepare for a different Ramadan amid the Covid-19 pandemic, they are urged to keep in mind the holy month's core activities of fasting and helping those in need through alms.

item.title: Coronavirus: Most construction firms able to arrange food for workers
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Most construction firms have been able to get meals for their foreign workers two days into a sector-wide stay-home notice, but migrant worker groups continue to see cases of workers going hungry.

item.title: Toddler's death at Jewel store ruled a tragic misadventure
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

The incident involving an 18-month-old girl who died after a free-standing mirror in a Jewel Changi Airport boutique fell on her last August has been ruled a tragic misadventure.

item.title: Ramadan still meaningful even if mosques remain closed: PM Lee
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Even though mosques in Singapore will remain closed throughout the Muslim fasting month of Ramadan, the country's religious leaders and teachers will make sure that the holy month will still be meaningful, assured Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong.

item.title: MOH tracks weekly coronavirus average for better sense of trends
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

A moving average figure has been adopted recently by the Ministry of Health (MOH) to describe Covid-19 cases in the country, a statistic more indicative of the trend than daily totals, experts said.

item.title: US pilot, two S'poreans charged with breaching orders not to go out
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

American commercial pilot Brian Dugan Yeargan was one of three people charged in court yesterday with breaching their stay-home notice or stay order in separate incidents.

item.title: Coronavirus: Over 2,100 caught for not observing safe distancing
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

Since the start of the circuit breaker period, more than 2,100 people have been caught breaching safe distancing rules, while over 500 did not wear a mask outside their homes.

item.title: 3-year-old girl with coronavirus still in hospital after 29 days
item.description:
April 22, 2020 5:00 AM

A total of 50 children and adolescents have been infected with the Covid-19 virus here, with around half of them still in hospital.

item.title: How education system changes can help more kids succeed
